Description: Egyptian terracotta figurine of Isis-Hathor. Fragment of bare feet only, wearing an anklet. Traces of white coating. Mould-made and hollow. Red-brown Nile silt with mica and white sandy inclusions.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Egyptian Museum, Cairo. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Found in third to the second century BC context. Leg and feet fragment of a Isis-Aphrodite anasyr(o)mene’ / Isis-Bubastis or more likely Isis-Hathor figure. Parallels dated to the Ptolemaic or Roman period across Egypt, with close parallels from Naukratis (Bailey 2008, no.2997, GR 1888,0601.110; Ashmolean Museum, Oxford, no. 1888.178; Cambridge, Museum of Classical Archaeology NA636).
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.143) (Phase 3)
Additional IDs: Excavation/small finds number: MC#53 (Finds catalogue number)
